definition[0]: to get a better job in a company, or change to a more advanced group, higher rank, or higher level
example[0]: To move up, you’ll need the right training.
example[1]: Share prices moved up this month.
example[2]: He was moving up the ladder (=getting higher and higher positions), and getting management experience.
example[3]: He’s moved up in the world (=got a better job or social position) in the last few years, and his new flat shows it.
example[4]: The kids learn fast, and can’t wait to move up to the junior team.
definition[1]: to change position in order to make more space for other people or things or be near someone else
example[5]: There’s room for one more if everyone moves up a bit.
